resources.string:
Documentation

SMSIntent is as small app that manages SMS templates which may or may not include questions / inqueries. The templates can with a simple tap / click be launched as an intent to the SMS app.

Create new template
Click the plus button in the action bar in the top. Templates will be created in the group that is currently opened.

Edit template
Long-tap the intent you want to edit and select the "Edit" item in the menu that appears.

Delete template
As with Edit template - just select the Delete item instead.

Template properties

Title
Used to identify the template in the list.

Address (optional)
Can optionally be used for declaring a recipient for the SMS.

Message
This is the message content for the template that may include questions that must be filled out prior to sending the SMS.

Insert question...
Use this button to intert a question to the message. If you want to edit an existing question in the message you must select it from "{?" to "}" before you click the button.

Question properties

Ask for
The question (or title thereof) that will be prompted.

As as ...
The type of data that should be gathered. This can be either plain text as a text field, a date as a date picker or a point in time as a time picker.

Groups

You can create groups by selecting the "Create group" menu item or by tapping the folder icon in the action bar. A group consists of a title and a default address that will be suggested to as default recipient for all templates created in the group. Groups are edited and deleted as templates and when a group is deleted all the templates in it are deleted with it. A group cannot contain other groups.

Use a template

In order to use a template you must simply tap it in the list. If the template has any questions in it a dialog will appear and ask you to answer the questions. When the SMS has been constructed it will be passed to the SMS app and SMSIntent will automatically close.

Import / Export templates

SMSIntent has a feature for exporting all templates to a file on an external media. External media might be an SD-card or it might be a shared location in the handsets internal memory. You can gain access to the export feature in the About box through the menu. The export button will only be enabled if templates are available and a writable storage option is present.

Importing previously exported templates can be done with the Import button next to the Export button. The import button will be disabled if no previously exported templates exists.

The location for the export file is: $EXP$
